instruction: What metric was chosen to evaluate the model performances in predicting Cr and Ni concentrations, and how far can this metric go?
Output:
The metric chosen to evaluate the model performances in predicting Cr and Ni concentrations is the coefficient of determination (R-2) and the root mean square error (RMSE). The R-2 value measures the proportion of the variance in the predicted Cr and Ni concentrations that can be explained by the model, with a higher value indicating a better fit. The RMSE measures the average difference between the predicted and actual Cr and Ni concentrations, with a lower value indicating a better fit.

The text does not provide information on how far these metrics can go in evaluating the model performances.
